definitions: To process something thoroughly and then reject or discard it in a damaged or altered state
To handle a task with such intensity or efficiency that the original form is unrecognizable or ruined
examples: Don't rush the data entry; AI will chew this project up and spit it out later if the parameters are wrong.
If we don't refine the code, the AI will chew this project up and spit it out later.
source: AI will chew this project up and spit it out later
